purpose.summary: This is the source file for generating an IMS Program Specification Block (PSB) named DLIGSAMP for a COBOL program (LANG=COBOL). It defines a primary database PCB (PAUTBPCB) for the IMS hierarchical database DBDNAME=DBPAUTP0 with PROCOPT=GOTP and KEYLEN=14, enabling access to root segment PAUTSUM0 (PARENT=0) and child segment PAUTDTL1 (PARENT=PAUTSUM0). It also defines two GSAM PCBs for DBDNAME=PASFLDBD and PADFLDBD, both with PROCOPT=LS.

inputs.name: DBPAUTP0
inputs.description: IMS hierarchical database PCB (PAUTBPCB) with PROCOPT=GOTP, KEYLEN=14, providing access to segments PAUTSUM0 and PAUTDTL1

inputs.name: PASFLDBD
inputs.description: IMS GSAM database PCB with PROCOPT=LS

inputs.name: PADFLDBD
inputs.description: IMS GSAM database PCB with PROCOPT=LS

open_questions.question: What is the business purpose of the databases DBPAUTP0 (segments PAUTSUM0, PAUTDTL1), PASFLDBD, and PADFLDBD?
open_questions.context: PSB source provides no descriptive comments or context beyond DBDNAMEs and segment names.
open_questions.suggestion: Review corresponding IMS DBD source files or application documentation for database purposes.

open_questions.question: Is this PSB intended for batch DL/I, IMS online (MPP/BMP), or other execution modes?
open_questions.context: PROCOPT=GOTP and LS provide access intent hints but do not specify program execution context.
open_questions.suggestion: Examine the DLIGSAMP COBOL program source, JCL, or IMS transaction/PSB assignments.

open_questions.question: What specific DL/I call types (GU, GN, ISRT, etc.) are authorized by these PROCOPT settings?
open_questions.context: PSB defines PCB-level PROCOPT but not per-segment or exact call permissions.
open_questions.suggestion: Refer to IMS documentation for PROCOPT=GOTP (DB) and LS (GSAM) implications and the program's DL/I calls.
